alert.note: Alert for Sussex (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 10:43AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Sussex County through 1115 AM EDT... At 1043 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Five Points, or near Newton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Newton, Montague, Hopatcong, Franklin, Hamburg, Ogdensburg, Sussex, Branchville, Andover, High Point, Lake Mohawk, Greendell, Vernon Valley, Five Points, Pellettown, Crandon Lakes, Highland Lake and Hainesville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
